text:
When placing fo:basic-link elements in separate columns of nested tables, the
corresponding linked areas in PDF-output are not rendered on top of the linked
texts as expected, but horizontally moved to the left, overlapping each other.
creator: Simon.Leidig@brave.de
Simon.Leidig@brave.de
text:
Created attachment 17780
FO input document

Simple FO document containing a nested table with two columns and a link within
each of them.

Created attachment 17781
PDF output

PDF output resulting from the given FO input. The linked area of the right link
is moved on top of the left link.
creator: Simon.Leidig@brave.de

text:
The incorrect positioning of link hotspots in FOP 0.20.5 is a known bug. 
Development of the old maintenance code was frozen long ago, so this bug will 
not be fixed there. I believe the bug doesn't exist in FOP's latest release 
0.91beta. So, if possible please upgrade.
creator: bowditch_chris@hotmail.com

text: Confirmed. The bug does not exist in the latest release (0.91beta).
creator: jeremias@apache.org
adelmelle@apache.org
text: *** Bug 18010 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
creator: gadams@apache.org
